content: Start with a diagnosis of prostatitis

children.content: Perform a history and physical examination

children.node: Urinalysis + urine culture; Urethral culture (if + risk factors for STD)
children.content: Conduct urinalysis, urine culture, and urethral culture if there are risk factors for STD
Consider the possibility of bladder cancer or urolithiasis
Positive urine culture or positive urethral culture

children.node: Consider: Acute bacterial prostatitis; Urinary tract infection
children.content: Consider the possibility of acute bacterial prostatitis or urinary tract infection

children.node: Consider: Chronic bacterial prostatitis; Prostate abscess
children.content: Consider the possibility of chronic bacterial prostatitis or prostate abscess

children.node: Urinalysis negative for infection and blood; Urethral culture negative
children.content: Urinalysis is negative for infection and blood; Urethral culture is negative

children.node: Exclude: Urethral stricture; Genital herpes; Benign prostatic hypertrophy; Neurogenic bladder; Genitourinary malignancy
children.content: Exclude urethral stricture, genital herpes, benign prostatic hypertrophy, neurogenic bladder, and genitourinary malignancy
Consider the possibility of chronic pelvic pain syndrome
